item.title: [IN-520] Add in jiffy input column finder autocomplete widget
item.description:
New a little text box that autocompletes as curator types in a column name - when column name seen in drop down then can select it. This also selects input column in the list and scrolls so that it is visible and does all the other stuff that happens when input column is selected.

Autocomplete list must be updated when a derived column is added. Should slot in innocuously under input column panel.
item.summary: Add in jiffy input column finder autocomplete widget

item.title: [IN-496] Vivax Ric feedback
item.description:
update pop-up content:
On left side I would give overall study details.
Total Number of patients enrolled (see Clinical Sheet)
Treatment Arms: CQ, DHP, AQAS etc (See Treatment Sheet).

On Right - I would give Chloroquine Efficacy (bold and underlined)
Quoting Number of patients enrolled at that site (see CQR sheet).
and CQ efficacy.
Omit the efficacy of other treatments since hard to compare in a standardised manner.

Create many to many relationship for publication and study.

item.title: [IN-486] Update vivax legend
item.description:
Legend might be better to have a direct link to the methodology. Also, the color does not correspond to the one used in methodology. It is slightly difficult to understand compared to p.f explorer which simply shows % of treatment failure, for example, difference between red one and dark orange one is a bit difficult to understand.

Not sure if a link from the legend to methods is needed. I think the methods tab above is pretty easy to find. Good point on the colours – this is correct. The colors in the methods tab are correct and the legend should be adapted accordingly. Also the sequence should be the same as in the methods part. And yes I agree it is more difficult to understand than P.f. but that’s just the nature of vivax I am afraid….

It might be clearer if we explain that this is on CQ somewhere on the page, such as 'vivax CQ surveyor' or in the legend. And I assume the 'uncategorised' means that efficacy of CQ monotherapy is not available regardless of the efficacy of other drugs. But it seems that some studies with <10 participants are also categorised as 'uncategorised'.

Perhaps add in the legend as follows: “categories of CQ resistance” as header?

item.title: [IN-418] Remove technical debt Mapper - post chassis & co-morbidity changes
item.description:
• Rationalise HibernateMan - so that we have session creation in only one module
  • ChassisUtils in MapperPersistnce Malaria should inherit from above and add a couple of methods
  • HibernateMan can also move to multidisease
  • Mapper server chassis II - Hibernate man should use mapper persistence tool
  • Need a generic and abstract MalariaChassisIIAccess
  • MalariaChassisIIAccess inherits from above and for oether diseases
  • Check what the Excel writer class does for muiltiple diseases
item.summary: Remove technical debt Mapper - post chassis & co-morbidity changes

item.title: [IN-20] Non-malarial febrile illness Surveyor
item.description: Non-malarial febrile illness (NMFI) disease maps present published health literature for causes of NMFI. These maps explore the geographical distribution of key pathogens identified as causing fever-driven illness other than malaria. They help to guide the development of improved algorithms for syndromic management of fever, prioritise diagnostic development, and potentially guide empirical therapy.

item.title: [IN-16] Molecular surveyor
item.description: The Molecular Surveyor is an interactive mapping tool that provides researchers and policy makers with an overview of the changes in the prevalence of molecular markers associated with malaria drug resistance over time and location. It helps to inform international, regional and national surveillance strategies.

item.title: [IN-15] Antimalarial Quality Surveyor
item.description: Antimalarial Quality Surveyor: visualises summaries of published reports of antimalarial medicine quality, displaying their geographical distribution across regions and over time. This tool is available in both French and English and provides country summaries.

item.title: [IN-14] K13 Molecular Surveyor
item.description: The K13 Molecular Surveyor is an interactive map that summarises the prevalence of these molecular markers in the propeller region of the Kelch 13 gene of the malaria parasite by location and year, providing a clear and standardised visualisation of the evidence to date to inform key international, regional and national monitoring strategies.

item.title: [IN-13] Schistosomiasis data platform
item.description:
We provide the Schistosomiasis community with a reliable and standardised data collection platform to facilitate data sharing, pooled data analyses, and application of these findings to provide evidence for policy makers and drug developers to optimise the therapeutic life of existing and new Schistosomiasis dugs

From an informatics point of view this project will contain the following stories:

  • An easy to use tool for schisto researches which will allow them to upload and edit data (schsitoExpress)
  • A complex tool for wwarn curators which will facilitate the cleaning and standarization of the data. (SchistoApp)
  • A visualization tool which will show a summary of all the data collected. (SchistoSurveyor)

item.title: [IN-12] Study Group Data Management
item.description:
This project aims to integrate different study group data from different clinical researches.

The main goals of this project are:

  • Create a single point of access to study group data
  • Standardized all the study group data
  • Facilitate the access to the study group information
  • Track feedback from all the contacts involved in a study group
